definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from

sentences.english: It is a pity because recently rumours that female the ghost begging meters of water, avoid gossip mirror hung the boss.
sentences.chinese: 可惜因爲近日盛傳女鬼乞米水，老闆掛着八卦鏡防避。

sentences.english: Shelter from strong winds is also basic requirement.
sentences.chinese: 防避強風也是基本要求。

sentences.english: The house has been screened against mosquitoes.
sentences.chinese: 房屋已裝上了紗窗紗門來防避蚊子。

definition: inspiration in a moment of desperation (idiom)/also written 情急之下
variant of 壓服|压服[ya1 fu2]
not in such a way as to/not likely to
to place in safe keeping/to leave sth with sb
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
the Great Sparrow Campaign or the Four Pests Campaign, one of the actions during the Great Leap Forward 大躍進|大跃进[Da4 yue4 jin4] aiming to eliminate four pests: rats, flies, mosquitoes, and sparrows
five chief demons of folklore personifying pestilence
